context: A security incident was detected involving a SID history injection. This SID history injection is detected on a device and was traced back to the account `lucasb` with a PowerShell command involving `net.exe` and `powershell.exe` on the host `vnevado-dc`. The detected process ids with their respective command lines are `3780` and `7712`. This suggests an attacker might be using SID history changes to achieve elevated privileges. Note: SID history is an attribute that supports migration scenarios and is usually targeted by attackers to gain elevated privileges and persist in the system.
question: There is also a suspected DCSync attack (replication of directory services) within the same incident. Can you identify the email of the user involved in the DCSync attack?
solution_steps: A SID history injection was detected on the account with AadUserId `7fcf9695-68fc-4258-864d-e1e5b166c66f`.

A suspected DCSync attack was performed by `Julian Burke (IT director)` using the email `Julian Burke@vnevado.alpineskihouse.co` on device `VNEVADO-Win10V`, sending a replication request to `VNEVADO-DC`.
